1.title_api: The C.J. Gable revenge game: Ticats running back returns with Esks
1.desc_api: GAME DAY: Thursday, 7:30 p.m. at Tim Hortons Field
1.caption_api: C.J. Gable is pursued by B.C. Lions’ Anthony Orange and Jordan Herdman on Aug. 9. Gable faces his old team in Hamilton Thursday.

2.title_api: Ticats would rather take a bye on bye weeks
2.caption_api: C.J. Gable, No. 2, is expected to be back in the Edmonton Eskimos lineup Thursday in Hamilton.

3.desc_api: Calgary stands a good chance of bouncing back from its first loss when it visits the Tiger-Cats, who are coming off of their bye.

4.title_api: Hamilton Tiger-Cats face stiff test against Edmonton’s Mike Reilly
4.desc_api: Thursday’s Edmonton-Hamilton game could come down to whether the Tiger-Cats’ pass rush can disrupt Reilly, who hangs in the pocket longer than any quarterback in the CFL.
4.caption_api: Edmonton quarterback Mike Reilly comes in as the league’s top performe as his team prepares to visit the Hamilton Tiger-Cats on Thursday.

5.title_api: Ticats legend honoured: From the Hall to the Wall
5.desc_api: Joe Montford has never forgotten that 1996 spring day — his first moment, ever, in Canada — when he arrived at the Hamilton Tiger-Cats training camp.
5.caption_api: Montford hams it up while waiting for a team photo to be snapped.

8.title_api: Nationality confusion forces Zabelinskaya out of Asian Games
8.desc_api: Nationality confusion forces Zabelinskaya out of Asian Games
8.caption_api: FILE - In this Aug. 10, 2016 file photo, cyclist Olga Zabelinskaya of Russian rides at the start of the women’s individual time trial event at the 2016 Summer Olympics in Pontal beach, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. One thing seems certain amid the conjecture over Olympic medalist Olga Zabelinskaya’s bid to switch nationality from Russia to Uzbekistan, she won’t be competing at the Asian Games. (AP Photo/Patrick Semansky,file)

11.desc_api: Panel not yet considering cost of Ohio State’s Meyer inquiry
11.caption_api: File-This July 24, 2018, file photo shows Ohio State head coach Urban Meyer speaking at the Big Ten Conference NCAA college football Media Days in Chicago. The Big Ten East has been called the toughest division in college football, and that‚Äôs expected to be the case again this season even with the uncertainty surrounding Meyer and his defending conference champion Ohio State Buckeyes. 12.title_api: More Salah? No sign of Liverpool forward slowing down
12.desc_api: More Salah? No sign of Liverpool forward slowing down
12.caption_api: Crystal Palace’s goalkeeper Wayne Hennessey, left, makes a save in front of Liverpool’s Mohamed Salah during the English Premier League soccer match between Crystal Palace and Liverpool at Selhurst Park stadium in London, Monday, Aug. 20, 2018. (AP Photo/Kirsty Wigglesworth)

13.title_api: Blue Bombers, Tiger-Cats get into head games
13.desc_api: Between Winnipeg coach Michael O’Shea and his penchant for special teams strategems and Hamilton coach June Jones’ run-and-shoot attack, each team has a lot to think about going into Friday night’s CFL showdown.
13.caption_api: Hamilton Tiger-Cats head coach June Jones fully expects the Winnipeg Blue Bombers, who are coming off of a bye week, “to do some funny things” on Friday.

14.title_api: Scouting report: Delvin Breaux a maybe for Ticats-Blue Bombers tilt
14.desc_api: Both Hamilton (3-4) and Winnipeg (4-3) are dealing with key injuries in their defensive coverage
14.caption_api: Defensive back Delvin Breaux, right, will be a game time decision after injuring himself in a collision with a teammate at practice earlier this week.

15.title_api: How seven Hamilton Tiger-Cats defensive backs became housemates
15.desc_api: After rookie defensive back Jackson Bennett found a place after training camp, teammates scrambling for accommodation all ended up living under the same Cannon Street roof.
15.caption_api: Seven Ticats defensive backs — from left to right, John Green, Jackson Bennett, Richard Leonard, Mariel Cooper, Frankie Williams, Jumal Rolle and Cariel Brooks — have rented a house together this season.

16.title_api: Sherman ready to make exhibition debut for 49ers
16.desc_api: Richard Sherman has been around the National Football League long enough that playing in exhibition games might not seem to be of critical importance.
16.caption_api: San Francisco 49ers cornerback Richard Sherman catches a ball during practice at the team’s headquarters in Santa Clara, Calif. Sherman joined San Francisco after getting released by rival Seattle following season-ending surgery to repair a ruptured Achilles tendon.

19.title_api: Despite recent crash, Canadian Mike Woods ready for second crack at Spanish Vuelta
19.desc_api: Mike Woods was hurtling down a hill on Stage 2 of the Tour of Utah when he turned a corner and hit some sand.

20.title_api: Shapovalov calm and cool ahead of U.S. Open
20.desc_api: Canadian star Shapovalov heading into second U.S. Open calm, cool and collected
20.caption_api: Denis Shapovalov, of Canada, serves the ball to Robin Haase, of the Netherlands, during round three of the men’s Rogers Cup tennis action in Toronto on August 9, 2018. Denis Shapovalov walked onto Arthur Ashe stadium last August and felt overwhelmed by the magnitude of the court, the brightness of the lights, and the cheers of the crowd. Then he started playing. And those outside distractions seemed to fade away. THE CANADIAN PRESS/Nathan Denette

21.title_api: Johnson, Koepka open strong as Woods gets off to even start
21.desc_api: Johnson, Koepka open strong as Woods gets off to even start
21.caption_api: Tiger Woods tees off on the 12th hole during the first round of the Northern Trust golf tournament, Thursday, Aug. 23, 2018, in Paramus, N.J. (AP Photo/Julio Cortez)

22.title_api: Cam Lard rejoins Iowa State hoops team after wellness centre
22.desc_api: Cam Lard rejoins Iowa State hoops team after wellness centre
22.caption_api: FILE - In this Feb. 13, 2018, file photo, Iowa State’s Cameron Lard (2) reacts after a dunk past Kansas’ Marcus Garrett (0) during the first half of an NCAA college basketball game in Ames, Iowa. Iowa State coach Steve Prohm said Thursday, Aug. 23, 2018, that Lard, who enrolled at a wellness center in early June instead of joining his teammates for summer workouts, rejoined the Cyclones earlier this month. Lard, who will be a sophomore next season, had a drug paraphernalia charge dismissed during a pretrial hearing in April. The 20-year-old Lard was also cited for being underage at an Ames bar this offseason. Those issues pushed Lard to spend time at a wellness center in an effort to make better decisions and improve as a person, according to Prohm. (AP Photo/Nati Harnik, File)

27.title_api: CFL announces immediate revisions to its touchdown celebration standard
27.desc_api: The CFL is relaxing its stance regarding the use of props during touchdown celebrations.

28.title_api: A-Rod and Jordy won’t be playing catch Friday night
28.desc_api: A-Rod and Jordy won’t be playing catch Friday night
28.caption_api: FILE - In this Nov. 19, 2017, file photo, Green Bay Packers’ Aaron Rodgers talks to Jordy Nelson before an NFL football game against the Baltimore Ravens, in Green Bay, Wis. The departure of receiver Jordy Nelson has left Rodgers in need of a new partner to take part in one of his pregame routines. In the end zone before a game would be Rodgers and Nelson playing catch and spinning footballs on their fingertips. That won’t happen Friday night now that Nelson is a Raider, though they remain good friends. (AP Photo/Mike Roemer)

29.title_api: Little League World Series spot an honour for umpires, too

30.desc_api: Orr and Tod divisions to play cross-over schedule in PJHL this season

31.title_api: Ohio State suspends Meyer for three games for mishandled abuse case
31.desc_api: Ohio State has suspended head football coach Urban Meyer three games for mishandling domestic violence accusations, punishing one of the sport’s most prominent leaders for keeping an assistant on staff for several years after that coach’s wife accused him of abuse.
31.caption_api: Ohio State football coach Urban Meyer answers questions during a news conference in Columbus, Ohio, this week.

32.title_api: Bengals QB to return the favour to Buffalo
32.desc_api: Whenever Andy Dalton is spotted by a Bills fan, he’ll hear another “thank you” for helping Buffalo break its long streak of playoff futility.
32.caption_api: Buffalo Bills fans flooded Andy Dalton’s foundation with donations after his touchdown pass helped Buffalo make the playoffs last season.

33.title_api: Als defence looks to tighten up vs. Argos
33.desc_api: Alouettes defence looks to tighten up against division-rival Argos
33.caption_api: Montreal Alouettes general manager Kavis Reed spent the off-season rebuilding the defence, but so far it has been the league’s worst. Reed speaks during a post-season news conference in Montreal, Saturday, November 4, 2017. THE CANADIAN PRESS/Graham Hughes

34.title_api: Tennessee defence facing big test to open Pruitt’s tenure
34.desc_api: Tennessee defence facing big test to open Pruitt’s tenure
34.caption_api: FILE - In this Oct. 14, 2017, file photo, Tennessee defensive lineman Kyle Phillips (5) chases South Carolina running back Rico Dowdle (5) in an NCAA college football game in Knoxville, Tenn. Tennessee’s defense will learn in a hurry just how far its defense has come under new coach Jeremy Pruitt - and how far it still has to go. (AP Photo/Wade Payne, File)

35.title_api: The ‘goal machine’ always scores in Turin
35.desc_api: Cristiano Ronaldo often scores goals. In Turin, Cristiano Ronaldo always scores goals.
35.caption_api: Cristiano Ronaldo loves scoring in Turin and the stage is set for him to score his debut goal for Juventus when it hosts Lazio at the Allianz Stadium on Saturday.

37.title_api: Sabres’ Eichel focuses on keeping fiery emotions in check
37.desc_api: Sabres’ Eichel focuses on keeping fiery emotions in check
37.caption_api: FILE - In this March 26, 2018, file photo, Buffalo Sabres center Jack Eichel (15) celebrates his goal against the Toronto Maple Leafs with right wing Jason Pominville (29) during the third of an NHL hockey game in Toronto. Eichel has come to the realization he can’t transform the Buffalo Sabres into contenders on emotion alone. After three frustrating campaigns, the face of the franchise tells The Associated Press he’s focused on taking a steadier approach if he intends to continue maturing into a team leader. (Frank Gunn/The Canadian Press via AP, File)

40.title_api: Hamilton Bulldogs say farewell to graduating players
40.desc_api: At the start of this season, the Hamilton Bulldogs will say goodbye to an unusually large class of graduating players.
40.caption_api: Captain Justin Lemcke, here, Ryan Moore and Connor Walters are moving on from the OHL champion Hamilton Bulldogs after playing a combined 354 games with the team.

41.title_api: Oklahoma WR Marquise Brown more than a speedster this year
41.desc_api: Oklahoma WR Marquise Brown more than a speedster this year
41.caption_api: FILE - In this Jan. 1, 2018, file photo, Oklahoma wide receiver Marquise Brown carries the ball during the Rose Bowl NCAA college football game against Georgia, in Pasadena, Calif. Marquise “Hollywood” Brown made his mark last season as a speedster. Now that he’s added tools and size in the offseason, he expects to be even more dangerous. He gained more than 1,000 yards receiving last season, and now, the junior is looking for more. He’ll be a marked man when the seventh-ranked Sooners open on Sept. 1 against Florida Atlantic. (AP Photo/Jae C. Hong)

42.title_api: Cal RB Patrick Laird takes meteoric rise up depth chart
42.desc_api: Cal RB Patrick Laird takes meteoric rise up depth chart
42.caption_api: FILE - In this Nov. 24, 2017, file photo, California running back Patrick Laird runs during the second half of an NCAA college football game against UCLA, in Los Angeles. Laird has come from seventh-string walk-on to leading man on California’s offense during his time with the Golden Bears.(AP Photo/Mark J. Terrill, File)
